channel.title: Need welcome message help!
channel.description:
How do i make this scroll interface show up for the welcome message when players log in?:
[IMG]http://i1031.photobucket.com/albums/y380/mrpopyman/welcometoradscaoe.gif[/img]

item.title: Need welcome message help!
item.dc:creator: @Clawz_fury lare69
item.description:
@Clawz_fury wrote:

Woopzpkedu:

clawz fury ur a dick cant u see hes new u fucking qeef thats why ppl go to r-server for help instead of lisening to bullshit so stfu u waste of dog sperm

  1. Learn to spell, because I don’t think me or any one else understood what you said.

  2. I did help him, and I was angry because he flamed the person that originally gave him the answer in the first place.

  3. R-Server sucks mad dick, full of spam and posters that don’t know how to speak properly, also, people only go to R-Server because they can’t get accepted by the awesome community of Mopar because they ethier:

  • Troll
  • Don’t speak properly, or act like an idiot, kind of like you.
  • Ask the stupid same questions over and over that have been answered over and over…
  • Act ignorant and stupid, also like you.

  1. I’m a nice person, ask plenty of people I have helped; I just don’t like when someone takes out the time to post the answer and gets flamed by a stupid OP.

  2. Don’t like Mopar? Sad that no one accepts you in this community? Leave, please; better for me, less idiots like you too help.

item.title: Need welcome message help!
item.dc:creator: @Clawz_fury lare69
item.description:
@Clawz_fury wrote:

You ungrateful piece of shit, TOMSCAPE just tried to help you, and you flame him; your lucky I’m a nice enough person to give you the answer.

Declare this, change the messages as you see fit.

public void initializeMsg() { sendQuest("Put title here", 8144); clearQuestInterface(); sendQuest("Text here", 8147); sendQuest("More text here", 8148); sendQuest("More text here", 8147); sendQuest("More text here", 8148); sendQuest("More text here", 8149); sendQuest("More text here", 8150); sendQuest("More text here", 8151); sendQuest("More text here", 8152); sendQuest("More text here", 8153); sendQuest("More text here", 8154); sendQuest("More text here", 8155); sendQuest("More text here", 8156); sendQuest("More text here", 8157); sendQuest("More text here", 8158); sendQuestSomething(8147); showInterface(8134); }

Now put this wherever your login message is:

initializeMsg();

Congratulations you have just completed the tutorial for doing the easiest shit possible.

Read full topic

item.title: Need welcome message help!
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

im sick and tired of seeing simple bs questions on the server help section. I sit here all the dam time looking through them trying to help kids out. and i see 4-5 posts of the same thing in the SAME day. Are people seriously that lame to not know how to use the search link.When i post questions on here i never get answered, and do you want to know why, because people love to spam ask the same stupid fricking questions and make my post’s fall 5 pages back and no one cares to look back there for questions. I’d love to see someone actually find one of my many topics that i stared and solve it in one try. not that easy.

And for your stupid question that I’ve seen more then once. Go into your SERVER files and find the file called Client.Java and open it. Then hit CTRL F and type in the search box for The server is back online!
If you still can’t figure it out, GTFO Runescape private server’s you noob. I’m not the only one sick of kids posting stupid questions on here

Read full topic

item.title: Need welcome message help!
item.dc:creator: @Untrimmed Untrimmed
item.description:
@Untrimmed wrote:

This really wasn’t that hard if you actually listened to him. Just put everything that you want to appear (the interface and such) in a method. You can change the name of the method from “startupshit” i’m pretty sure you can figure the rest out, if not then just PM me.

Read full topic

@Untrimmed wrote:

He really wasn’t messing with you, he just didn’t think of a good name to call the method thats all. You could have changed the name of the method and followed the rest of his instructions, which were completely correct.

item.title: Need welcome message help!
item.dc:creator: @Tom Tom
item.description:
@Tom wrote:

Put it inside a method, i.e.

public void startUpShit () {
// scroll code
}

Then find the initialize method and call it inside there. This will open the scroll when the player logs in. Put it near where it sends the message on login.

Read full topic
